resource_explanation: Pathway result is the result of a pathway
explanation: Creates a new pathway result. This is the intended method of inviting a candidate to a pathway.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the candidate that will be invited into the pathway process. If missing, then an email must be provided.
parameters.name: data.team_candidate_id
parameters.description: The ID of the candidate that will be invited into the pathway process. If missing, then an email must be provided.

parameters.markdown: The email of the candidate that will be invited into the pathway process. If missing, then a TeamCandidate ID must be provided.
parameters.name: data.email
parameters.description: The email of the candidate that will be invited into the pathway process. If missing, then a TeamCandidate ID must be provided.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the pathway candidates are being invited to. If missing, then a PathwaySet ID must be provided.
parameters.name: data.pathway_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pathway candidates are being invited to. If missing, then a PathwaySet ID must be provided.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the pathway set candidates are being invited to. If missing, then a Pathway ID must be provided.
parameters.name: data.pathway_set_id
parameters.description: The ID of the pathway set candidates are being invited to. If missing, then a Pathway ID must be provided.

parameters.markdown: Array of tags associated with the candidate. Must be provided, even as an empty array.
parameters.name: data.rule_tags
parameters.description: Array of tags associated with the candidate. Must be provided, even as an empty array.

parameters.markdown: First name of candidate. Will only be used if the candidate is new.
parameters.name: data.first_name
parameters.description: First name of candidate. Will only be used if the candidate is new.

parameters.markdown: Last name of candidate. Will only be used if the candidate is new.
parameters.name: data.last_name
parameters.description: Last name of candidate. Will only be used if the candidate is new.

parameters.markdown: An array of label strings to assign to the candidate. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of label strings to assign to the candidate. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.

parameters.markdown: Pathway step on which the candidate should start. If not set, the default is the first step in the pathway.
parameters.name: data.initial_step
parameters.description: Pathway step on which the candidate should start. If not set, the default is the first step in the pathway.

enum.reopen: Reopens the assessment result when the candidate visits the assessment. The candidate will be able to resume where they left off.
enum.retake: The candidate will be asked to start a new assessment, without carrying any previous work over. The original assessment result data will be kept as a separate record, and the new retake will be the featured result within the Qualified team UI.

parameters.markdown: Retry action to apply on assessments within the pathway previously passed by the candidate. If not set, previously passed assessments will be skipped.
parameters.name: data.retry_action
parameters.description: Retry action to apply on assessments within the pathway previously passed by the candidate. If not set, previously passed assessments will be skipped.

id.desc: The ID of the step result. Needed when making calls on a step result.

state.desc: The current state for each step result.

response_fields.markdown: An array of the pathway step results belonging to the pathway result.
response_fields.name: pathwayStepResults
response_fields.description: An array of the pathway step results belonging to the pathway result.

resource_explanation: A pathway contains one or more assessments.
explanation: Creates a new pathway step.

parameters.name: pathway_id
parameters.description: Pathway ID

parameters.markdown: What this pathway step will be titled as.
parameters.name: data.title
parameters.description: What this pathway step will be titled as.

parameters.markdown: Key used externally as a milestone identifier
parameters.name: data.milestone_key
parameters.description: Key used externally as a milestone identifier

parameters.markdown: Set as false by default, if set to true regular workflows will be processed.
parameters.name: data.process_workflow_rules
parameters.description: Set as false by default, if set to true regular workflows will be processed.

max_failing_challenges.desc: Max number of challenges a candidate can fail regardless of score.

disable_cut_scores.desc: If set to true, passing scores will be ignored. 'min_qualified_score' or 'min_accuracy_score' must be set.

min_qualified_score.desc: Minimum Qualified Score required to pass the step. Only used if cut scores are disabled.

min_accuracy_score.desc: Minimum Accuracy Score required to pass the step. Only used if cut scores are disabled.

min_review_rating.desc: Minimum review score that a candidate's assessment result needs to pass.

min_reviews.desc: Minimum number of reviews an assessment result requires in order for a step to pass.

parameters.markdown: The rules that determine if a step result passes. By default, all values are null.
parameters.name: data.pass_rules
parameters.description: The rules that determine if a step result passes. By default, all values are null.

min_active_time_mins.desc: Minimum amount of minutes an assessment result should take. Otherwise, it will be flagged.

max_flagged_insights.desc: Max number of insights an assessment result can have before the step is flagged.

max_similarity_risks.desc: Max number of similarity risks an assessment result can have before the step is flagged.

parameters.markdown: The rules that determine if a step result is flagged. By default, all values are null.
parameters.name: data.flag_rules
parameters.description: The rules that determine if a step result is flagged. By default, all values are null.

When they submit their solution, these test results will never show up on their screen. This is a great way to test for things like edge cases and performance tests that you don't want to give away.\n\n### Tagged Tests\nInterpreting test results just got a whole lot better with tags! Tags allows you to break up your test cases into different categories. \"Basic\" vs \"Advanced\". \"Edge Cases\", \"Performance\", etc. You name it. We will show you a passed/failed report not only for the total test cases but also by tag groupings.\n\n### Weighted Tests\nHave you ever wanted one test case to count for more of the score than another? Now you can with weighted test cases.\n", "announcementHtml": "

We've expanded our testing facilities with 3 new advanced testing features.

\n

Hidden Tests

\n

It's now possible to hide specific test cases from ever being shown to candidates. When they submit their solution, these test results will never show up on their screen. This is a great way to test for things like edge cases and performance tests that you don't want to give away.

\n

Tagged Tests

\n

Interpreting test results just got a whole lot better with tags! Tags allows you to break up your test cases into different categories. "Basic" vs "Advanced". "Edge Cases", "Performance", etc. You name it. We will show you a passed/failed report not only for the total test cases but also by tag groupings.

\n

Weighted Tests

\n

Have you ever wanted one test case to count for more of the score than another? Now you can with weighted test cases.

\n

\n

", "thumbnail": null, "relatedFeatureName": null, "type": "improvement", "created": "2017-12-20", "documentation": null, "plans": null }, { "title": "Improved Saving Feedback During Assessments", "blurb": "Candidates and Students will be alerted to network issues so they won't lose their work.", "announcement": "We've added feedback and reduced the risk of data loss for candidates & students when they may experience network issues. As before, all edits are automatically saved while working on an assessment.\n\nPreviously if the network went down, there was no way for a test participant to know that their changes might be lost.\n\nNow the app will warn the candidate after 5 failed attempts. This warning freezes the display, and prevents further modification of the solution to reduce the risk of data loss. We've also gone one step further, and all current, unsaved changes are stored client-side. If the candidate reloads the page, they will be prompted to restore their unsaved work.\n\nWe believe these changes will help significantly reduce the risk of data loss for anyone taking an assessment.\n", "announcementHtml": "

We've added feedback and reduced the risk of data loss for candidates & students when they may experience network issues. As before, all edits are automatically saved while working on an assessment.

\n

Previously if the network went down, there was no way for a test participant to know that their changes might be lost.

\n

Now the app will warn the candidate after 5 failed attempts. This warning freezes the display, and prevents further modification of the solution to reduce the risk of data loss. We've also gone one step further, and all current, unsaved changes are stored client-side. If the candidate reloads the page, they will be prompted to restore their unsaved work.

\n

We believe these changes will help significantly reduce the risk of data loss for anyone taking an assessment.

", "thumbnail": null, "relatedFeatureName": null, "type": "improvement", "created": "2018-02-08", "documentation": null, "plans": null }, { "title": "Improvements To Assessment Invitations", "blurb": "We've made major updates to make inviting candidates work better in more workflows!", "announcement": "We've updated the Invite Candidate / Invite Student workflow to enable you to use it in more scenarios.\n\n- You can immediately add new candidates to labels when you invite them.\n- Send a preview of the invite email to yourself\n- Create an invitation without sending the email immediately. This enables you to delay sending emails, or\n- Copy the invite links, and send a custom email yourself!\n\nYou also might notice a few changes in how we present invitations. Previously, we showed the invitations & controls in their own table inside the candidate details page. Now, invitations are down inside the set of results, making management of the assessment result simpler as everything is in one place.\n", "announcementHtml": "

We've updated the Invite Candidate / Invite Student workflow to enable you to use it in more scenarios.

\n
    \n
  • You can immediately add new candidates to labels when you invite them.
    • \n
  • Send a preview of the invite email to yourself
    • \n
  • Create an invitation without sending the email immediately. This enables you to delay sending emails, or
    • \n
  • Copy the invite links, and send a custom email yourself!
    • \n
\n

You also might notice a few changes in how we present invitations. Previously, we showed the invitations & controls in their own table inside the candidate details page. Now, invitations are down inside the set of results, making management of the assessment result simpler as everything is in one place.

", "thumbnail": null, "relatedFeatureName": null, "type": "improvement", "created": "2017-11-30", "documentation": "hire/invite.md", "plans": null }, { "title": "Improvements To Taking Assessments (Dark Mode & More)", "blurb": "A significantly improved dark mode, more help for debugging, layout improvements, and more.", "announcement": "We've revamped the interface for taking code challenges to be much friendlier to candidates & students.\n\n- A new-and-improved Dark Mode makes most of the UI dark for editing code, like your favorite IDE. It can also be selected before the candidate even starts the challenge.\n- A two-pane layout for smaller screens (automatically switches, or the candidate can force compact or full layout).\n- New embedded help for debugging, accessible via a link right in the editor, provides helpful hints on how to debug your code.\n- Improved dark mode comes to the challenge editor, as well.\n\n![Dark Mode with Compact Layout](/kb/images/changes/improvements_to_taking_assessments_dark_mode_more/dark-mode.png)\n", "announcementHtml": "

We've revamped the interface for taking code challenges to be much friendlier to candidates & students.

\n
    \n
  • A new-and-improved Dark Mode makes most of the UI dark for editing code, like your favorite IDE. It can also be selected before the candidate even starts the challenge.
    • \n
  • A two-pane layout for smaller screens (automatically switches, or the candidate can force compact or full layout).
    • \n
  • New embedded help for debugging, accessible via a link right in the editor, provides helpful hints on how to debug your code.
    • \n
  • Improved dark mode comes to the challenge editor, as well.
    • \n
\n

resource_explanation: One or more QuizQuestions are associated to a QuizChallenge (aka "Q&A Challenge"). These questions define the questions that a candidate will be given.
explanation: Creates a quiz question for a QuizChallenge. $type must be provided to specify the type of question being created. $type cannot be changed once the record is created.

parameters.markdown: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.
parameters.name: data.prompt
parameters.description: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.

parameters.markdown: The model type of the question.
parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The model type of the question.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.
parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.

parameters.markdown: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.
parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.

parameters.markdown: The weight to assign to this question. The default is 1.
parameters.name: data.weight
parameters.description: The weight to assign to this question. The default is `1`.

parameters.markdown: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.
parameters.name: data.all_or_nothing
parameters.description: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.

id.desc: The ID of the choice. When making updates, you will want to preserve this value so that previous existing answers can be properly reported on.

label.desc: The text of the choice. Markdown is supported.

value.desc: The value/weight of the choice. Use 0 if the choice is not correct. Negative values are also supported, which can be used to take away points from other correct choices selected.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.
parameters.name: data.choices
parameters.description: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.

parameters.markdown: The total number of choices a candidate can select.
parameters.name: data.max_selections
parameters.description: The total number of choices a candidate can select.

parameters.markdown: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.
parameters.name: data.max_sum
parameters.description: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.

parameters.markdown: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.
parameters.name: data.weighted_scoring
parameters.description: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.

parameters.markdown: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.
parameters.name: data.min_characters
parameters.description: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.

parameters.markdown: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.
parameters.name: data.max_characters
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.

parameters.markdown: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.
parameters.name: data.default_value
parameters.description: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.

case.desc: True if case sensitivity should be used.

multi.desc: True if multiline regex flag should be used.

negate.desc: True if the the answer SHOULD'T match.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.
parameters.name: data.matches
parameters.description: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.

explanation: Updates an existing question on a QuizChallenge.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the question you wish to update.

parameters.name: challenge_id
parameters.description: Recommended for faster question lookup.

parameters.markdown: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.
parameters.name: data.prompt
parameters.description: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.

parameters.markdown: The model type of the question.
parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The model type of the question.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.
parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.

parameters.markdown: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.
parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.

parameters.markdown: The weight to assign to this question. The default is 1.
parameters.name: data.weight
parameters.description: The weight to assign to this question. The default is `1`.

parameters.markdown: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.
parameters.name: data.all_or_nothing
parameters.description: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.

id.desc: The ID of the choice. When making updates, you will want to preserve this value so that previous existing answers can be properly reported on.

label.desc: The text of the choice. Markdown is supported.

value.desc: The value/weight of the choice. Use 0 if the choice is not correct. Negative values are also supported, which can be used to take away points from other correct choices selected.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.
parameters.name: data.choices
parameters.description: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.

parameters.markdown: The total number of choices a candidate can select.
parameters.name: data.max_selections
parameters.description: The total number of choices a candidate can select.

parameters.markdown: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.
parameters.name: data.max_sum
parameters.description: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.

parameters.markdown: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.
parameters.name: data.weighted_scoring
parameters.description: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.

parameters.markdown: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.
parameters.name: data.min_characters
parameters.description: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.

parameters.markdown: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.
parameters.name: data.max_characters
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.

parameters.markdown: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.
parameters.name: data.default_value
parameters.description: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.

case.desc: True if case sensitivity should be used.

multi.desc: True if multiline regex flag should be used.

negate.desc: True if the the answer SHOULD'T match.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.
parameters.name: data.matches
parameters.description: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.

resource_explanation: One or more QuizQuestions are associated to a QuizChallenge (aka "Q&A Challenge"). These questions define the questions that a candidate will be given.
explanation: Deletes the specified quiz question from the associated QuizChallenge. The operation is not reversible, the question data will be lost.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the question you wish to delete.

parameters.name: challenge_id
parameters.description: Recommended for faster question lookup.

explanation:
Creates a new solution of the type specified. This is an alias endpoint for the subtype specific route.
        See each type specific section for more details. For this example, this route is actually linking to the
        POST /v1/qui_solutions route.

parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The type of solution to create

parameters.name: data.language
parameters.description: initial language the user started in

parameters.name: data.assessment_result_id
parameters.description: data.assessment result

parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: data.challenge

description: Impersonate a team members candidate user

explanation:
Authenticates the user credentials and returns an auth token. The user found must match
      the type specified. A 404 will be returned if a user with the type specified is not found.
      When providing the type parameter, only one object type token will be returned, and the resource
      will always be returned as data.

parameters.name: data.email
parameters.description: A valid email

parameters.name: data.password
parameters.description: Password

parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The type of user that must be present. Values = Candidate, TeamMember, Admin

resource_explanation: Team Candidates are the users whom take an assessment. While they have their own user account, the TeamCandidate record is always data specific to your team.
explanation: Updates basic info for a team candidate.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the candidate you wish to update.

parameters.name: data.email
parameters.description: A valid email for the candidate.

parameters.name: data.first_name
parameters.description: First name for the candidate.

parameters.name: data.last_name
parameters.description: Last name for the candidate.

parameters.name: data.alternate_id
parameters.description: Used for teams to track their own IDs alongside candidates.

parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of strings of all labels that should be assigned.

parameters.name: data.blinding
parameters.description: How the candidate should be blinded. By default they are blinded to blind_reviewers only

resource_explanation: Team Candidates are the users whom take an assessment. While they have their own user account, the TeamCandidate record is always data specific to your team.
explanation: Takes an action on a set of candidates at once. In addition to performing an action (such as archiving), it also allows certain fields to be updated.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: ids of team candidates to process

parameters.name: bulk_action
parameters.description: The action to take.

parameters.name: data.add_labels
parameters.description: Array of strings to add to the existing labels

parameters.name: data.remove_labels
parameters.description: Array of strings to remove from the existing labels

parameters.name: data.add_note
parameters.description: a note to add to all candidates

curl "https://www.qualified.io/api/v1/team_notifications" -d '{"data":{"team_id":"67bf790bdc3c653b17430627","message":"Notification","link":"link.com","link_title":"follow link","warning_level":"info"}}' -X POST \
